intro: Heteromorpha betsileensis, commonly known as the Betsileo heteromorpha, is a unique flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments within the rainforests of the island. Its floral structure is adapted for pollination by specific insect species, contributing to its ecological significance. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
